de.esoco.lib.json

Class Json

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.json.Json

  • public class Json
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains declarations and functions for the handling of JSON data.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Json.JsonStructure
      Enumeration of the available JSON structures.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.text.DateFormat JSON_DATE_FORMAT
      A Java DateFormat instance for the formatting of JSON date value in ISO 8601 format.
      static RelationType<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> JSON_PROPERTIES
      A map containing the properties of a JSON object structure.
      static RelationType<de.esoco.lib.text.TextConvert.IdentifierStyle> JSON_PROPERTY_NAMING
      The style for the naming of properties when building or parsing JSON.
      static RelationType<java.util.Collection<RelationType<?>>> JSON_SERIALIZED_TYPES
      The relation types of a Relatable object that should be considered for JSON serialization.

        public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String sOriginal)
        Creates a JSON compatible value by escaping the control characters in it.
        Parameters:
        sOriginal - The original string to escape
        Returns:
        The escaped string

      • parse

        public static java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String sJson)
        Parses a JSON string with a new JsonParser instance by invoking JsonParser.parse(String).
        Parameters:
        sJson - The input string
        Returns:
        The parsed result
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON

      • parse

        public static <T> T parse(java.lang.String sJson,
                          java.lang.Class<T> rDatatype)
        Parses a JSON string of a certain datatype with a new JsonParser instance by invoking JsonParser.parse(String, Class).
        Parameters:
        sJson - The input string
        rDatatype - The target datatype
        Returns:
        The parsed result
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON or doesn't match the given datatype

      • parseArray

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray)
        Parses a JSON array into a list.
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array to parse
        Returns:
        The resulting list of parsed elements
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON

      • parseArray

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Object> parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray,
                                                          int nDepth)
        Parses a JSON array into a list with limited depth. Limiting the depth will leave deeper levels as raw JSON strings, allowing to parse them into specific datatypes after inspection. For example, using a depth of 1 will return a list of raw JSON strings (unless the JSON array is not empty, in which case the list will be empty too).
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array to parse
        nDepth - The depth up to which parse values into objects
        Returns:
        The resulting list of parsed elements
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON

      • parseArray

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> parseArray(java.lang.String sJsonArray,
                                               java.lang.Class<T> rElementType)
        Parses a JSON array into a list with the given element datatype.
        Parameters:
        sJsonArray - The JSON array to parse
        rElementType - The datatype to parse the array elements with
        Returns:
        The resulting list of parsed elements
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not valid JSON or cannot be parsed into a list of elements of the given type

      • parseObject

        public static JsonObject parseObject(java.lang.String sJson)
        Parses a JSON string into a JsonObjectwith a new instance of JsonParser by invoking JsonParser.parseObject(String).
        Parameters:
        sJson - The input string
        Returns:
        The parsed object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not a valid JSON object

      • parseObject

        public static JsonObject parseObject(java.lang.String sJson,
                                     int nDepth)
        Parses a JSON string up to a certain depth into a JsonObject. Creates a new instance of JsonParser with the given depth and then invokes JsonParser.parseObject(String). Limiting the depth will leave deeper levels as raw JSON strings, allowing to parse them into specific datatypes after inspection.
        Parameters:
        sJson - The input string
        nDepth - The depth up to which parse the JSON hierarchy
        Returns:
        The parsed result
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the input string is not a valid JSON object

      • restore

        public static java.lang.String restore(java.lang.String sEscaped)
        Restores a string from an escaped JSON string.
        Parameters:
        sEscaped - The escaped string to restore
        Returns:
        The restored string

      • toCompactJson

        public static java.lang.String toCompactJson(java.lang.Object rValue)
        Converts a value into a compact JSON string without linefeeds and unnecessary whitespace. To get a more readable formatted string use toJson(Object) instead.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to convert
        Returns:
        The JSON string
        See Also:
        JsonBuilder.toJson(Object)

      • toJson

        public static java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object rValue)
        Converts a value into a JSON string with the default settings of the JsonBuilder class. The returned string contains linefeeds and whitespace for better readability. To get a more compact formatted string use toCompactJson(Object) instead.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to convert
        Returns:
        The JSON string
        See Also:
        JsonBuilder.toJson(Object)
